title: Ukraine's president is under growing pressure. Here are 5 things to know
description: The president of Ukraine is facing a confluence of crises testing his ability to lead an increasingly weary nation nearly four years into a devastating full-scale invasion by Russia.  For more than a week, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has struggled to contain the fallout from a $100 million corruption scandal implicating top officials and other associates.  The pressure on Zelenskyy has ratcheted up as the United States pushes a proposal it drew up with Russia that would require major concessions from Ukraine — and seemingly few from Russia — to bring an end to the war.

title: Florida eviction turns deadly as a deputy is killed, shooter and 2 others wounded
description: A Florida sheriff's deputy was killed while attempting to serve an eviction notice Friday in a beachside residence on the state's Atlantic coast, a county sheriff said.  The accused shooter, another deputy and a locksmith working for law enforcement were all wounded, Indian River County Sheriff Eric Flowers said at a news conference.  The locksmith, who was not identified by officials, and the shooter remained in critical condition Friday night following surgery, said Alexander Hagan, a spokesman for HCA Florida Lawnwood Hospital.

title: The president’s biographer says it’s “enormously important” to Trump to be seen as “the guy the women are around.”
description: President Donald Trump surrounds himself with women who have the same general look because he wants people to think that they are “available” to him, his biographer says. Michael Wolff, co-host of the Daily Beast’s Inside Trump’s Head podcast, says it is “enormously important” to Trump, 79, to be seen as “the guy the women are around.” “There is always an entourage of good-looking—younger, good-looking women around Trump, all dressed the same and all who basically look the same,” Wolff told co-host Joanna Coles, before recalling what a juror in Trump’s criminal trial in New York last year had told him about that.

Meet the AI workers who tell their friends and family to stay away from AI
description:
When the people making AI seem trustworthy are the ones who trust it the least, it shows that incentives for speed are overtaking safety, experts say
Krista Pawloski remembers the single defining moment that shaped her opinion on the ethics of artificial intelligence. As an AI worker on Amazon Mechanical Turk – a marketplace that allows companies to hire workers to perform tasks like entering data or matching an AI prompt with its output – Pawloski spends her time moderating and assessing the quality of AI-generated text, images and videos, as well as some factchecking.
Roughly two years ago, while working from home at her dining room table, she took up a job designating tweets as racist or not. When she was presented with a tweet that read “Listen to that mooncricket sing”, she almost clicked on the “no” button before deciding to check the meaning of the word “mooncricket”, which, to her surprise, was a racial slur against Black Americans.
 Continue reading...

title: Bro boost: women say their LinkedIn traffic increases if they pretend to be men

Collective experiment found switching profile to ‘male’ and ‘bro-coding’ text led to big increase in reach, though site denies favouring posts by men

If not, it could be because you’re not a man.

title: The internet is loving 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry's crusade against Nvidia and the AI giants
description: Michael Burry of "The Big Short" is lighting up social media after betting against Nvidia and Palantir and casting doubt on the AI boom.

title: An Alzheimer's researcher walks 2 miles a day to keep his brain healthy as he ages. Here's the science.
description: A Harvard neurologist shares how many steps you should aim for each day for a healthy brain to prevent memory loss and cognitive decline.

title: Republicans to Trump: No $2,000 tariff checks
description: Trump says that $2,000 tariff checks are coming mid-2026. His GOP allies on Capitol Hill aren't so sure.

title: I put company logos on my suit to pay for my wedding. It led to a new job.
description: Entrepreneur Dagobert Renouf funded his wedding by selling company logo spaces on his suit. The unusual idea led to a job in tech sales.

title: Inside the private clubs for the Gen Z and millennial day traders serious about making money in markets
description: Members of private day trading clubs who offered Business Insider a glimpse into their circles said social events and networking were perks of membership.

title: The stock market's new most-hated word is pummeling the AI trade
description: Last month it was circularity. This month, it's depreciation.

title: After my mom died, I found it harder to be present for my own kids. Now I'm finding ways for her to still shape my parenting.
description: My life shifted in a way I never expected after my mom died and it became difficult for me to parent my own kids. I'm finding strength in her memory.

title: I quit JPMorgan and took a 70% pay cut. It was a scary decision, but I finally feel meaningfully busy, not calendar busy.
description: Meet Semlani quit JPMorgan in 2018 when life felt robotic. He says the risky move helped him redefine success and raise $6 million for his startup.

title: ChatGPT wants to join your group chats
description: ChatGPT wants to conquer a new territory: the group chat. It'll joint the conversation with your friends. But do you really want it? I tried it.

title: Thousands of Americans in their 80s are working in some of the most dangerous professions.
description: Thousands of Americans over 80 work in sometimes risky or even dangerous jobs — some because they need the money, others because they want purpose.

title: Flying taxi CEO said Embraer's yet-to-fly aircraft will soar over traffic by 2027 and eventually be pilotless. Meet Eve.
description: Embraer believes the future of short-distance travel is an electric-powered aircraft that flies like a fixed-winged plane and lands like a helicopter.

title: I always struggled to wake up early, but a new habit helped me become a morning person overnight. Now, I feel energized.
description: Snoozing and waking up as late as possible made Kim Schewitz feel sluggish, but she couldn't stop. Here's how she quickly went from being a late-riser to a workout-before-work kind of girl.

title: More than half of U.S. homes have dropped in value over the last year — and nearly all houses in these cities have seen losses
description: "Home values surged over the past six years, and the vast majority of homeowners still have significant equity. What we're seeing now is a normalization, not a crash."

title: Republican and Democratic senators alike oppose Trump’s Ukraine peace plan that acquiesces to many Russian demands
description: The plan was crafted by the Trump administration and the Kremlin without Ukraine’s involvement.

title: Caesars Palace fined $7.8 million over Shohei Ohtani interpreter’s money laundering issues
description: The Nevada Gaming Control Board alleged that Caesars Palace failed to verify bookmaker Mathew Bowyer's source of funds as he gambled between 2017 and 2024.

title: Coast Guard revises policy on ‘a noose, a swastika, and any symbols or flags co-opted or adopted by hate-based groups’
description: Hours after the revelation that it would describe them as "potentially divisive," the Coast Guard made clear, these are "prohibited."

title: Trump enlists Jack Nicklaus to help revamp the ‘president’s golf course’ — raising questions about who will pay the golf legend and how much
description: Nicklaus “will be the architect" and "design it,” Trump told reporters.

title: Fugees rapper sentenced to 14 years in prison for illegally funneling millions from a Malaysian billionaire into Obama’s 2012 campaign
description: In April 2023, a federal jury convicted Michel of 10 counts, including conspiracy and acting as an unregistered agent of a foreign government.

title: The Fed is so divided that the next vote on rates could result in an unprecedented tie, analysts say. ‘Then things would get really messy’
description: Capital Economics sketched out a potential scenario where six Fed policymakers vote to keep rates steady while six vote to cut them again.

title: Hedge fund billionaire Bill Ackman is reportedly readying Pershing Square and a new fund to go public as soon as early next year
description: Ackman plans to orchestrate a double public offering as soon as early next year, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Wall Street eyes a possible culprit in this week’s head-spinning stock market reversal: Bitcoin
description: "It's possible that the rout in bitcoin is forcing some investors to sell stocks that they own."

title: Flying While Brown and Bearded
description: Shaan...
